Keeping eyes on the kids/pets
Watching over your grandma/grandpa
Surveillance around the house

Leaving for an extended vacation
Security for rentals
Surveillance in the front/back yard
 Weatherproof -- Never QuitWeatherproof design makes it work in a wide variety of harsh weather conditions, including rain, snow, intense cold and heat. The IP-65 certified weatherproof camera braves it all, and has no limited placements. You can put it outside or inside. 
Tech Specs
Perks ShippingWe ship the products worldwide with FREE Shipping. There are no additional customs charges shipping to these countries: US, UK, Canada, Germany, France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Spain, Italy, Portugal, Ireland, Austria, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Malta, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Sweden.We are not responsible for any extra fees from customs shipping to the countries and regions not listed above. The first shipment will sent out to customers who ordered from the first day of our campaign to May 1st (PDT), and for those who ordered after May 1st, you will get your order shipped out in late June.Once your order is shipped, you will receive our shipping notification email with the tracking number. By backing now, you will get up to 20% off the original price, you will receive the product(s) earlier than others, and you will get the up-to-date exclusive updates and information about the products as well as other first-class products. What's in the Box
Reolink Event Test Videos By Reolink Argus Sample Video in Day Time Sample Videos in Night Time Project TimelineThanks for all your support!Reolink Argus is now into mass production. 
Meet the Team
Established in 2009, Reolink has been devoted to cutting-edge security camera technology, and has a lot of experience in security camera solutions. "Innovator" and "innovative products" are 2 big value to our team. We strive to develop innovative and progressive security camera products that meet customers' needs.We have a R;D team with professional experience of years to rigorously research, design and test the hardware, firmware and software. The team possesses best technology integration and development capabilities.In addition to our core team, we've assembled an incredible group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with us to create the best products possible. At Reolink, we firmly believe security matters most and it should be for everyone. That’s why we make our security products professional, reliable, affordable, simple, and DIY style. Contact UsGeneral Enquiry & Support Help: support@reolink.comPress and Sample Review: contact@reolink.com Follow Us at

story:
Welcome to the ultimate heavy metal

"The weight was a complete surprise. You weren't kidding about how dense it is." 
- Nick M.

"Thanks for a terrific Kickstarter idea. I'm giving this to to the foundation of my family - My wife. Symbolic gift for a solid marriage :)"

- Runar P.

It's time to claim elemental superiority with the KILO cube: a solid KILOGRAM cube of aerospace-grade Tungsten.  

Here is a conversation I have almost daily at my desk:

Passer-by notices cube: "What is that, it looks cool/awesome!" 
Me: "It's a solid tungsten cube" 
Passer-by tries to pick it up: "What the #$%# why is it so @#$@ heavy!!???"

EARLY BIRD UNLOCKED for our most popular cube!

Why do I need the KILO cube?

  • You are a metal junkie and need a centerpiece for your collection - pretty much the densest thing you can own in this size.
  • You are an educator and you want to shock your students with the density of Tungsten, creating a memorable experience.
  • You want to have the coolest thing in the office - the ultimate conversation starter.
  • You want the ultimate "structure" item to focus on for creative unleashing or meditation

Why Tungsten?

  • 70% denser than lead
  • Denser than Uranium
  • Nearly impossible to melt
  • 4x harder than Titanium
  • 19x denser than water

Tungsten has the highest melting point of any element.  In fact, you can't easily build a container to melt it.  You have to resort to expensive powder compression methods to form it. 

The manufacturing process is truly amazing.  A pressure of 60 tons per square inch is used to create the cube in a giant steel press. 

Tungsten is an extremely rare element (only 100 parts per billion in the earth's crust).

What people are saying about the KILO:

"This tungsten cube is a great example of what we call a "structure" in the coaching profession -- something that reminds us to bring focus and attention to positive changes we are seeking to make. Be a positive deviant and get in on this cool Kickstarter." - Margaret Greenberg, Author of Profit From the Positive, McGraw-Hill Professional 

"Good Evening Jaime, This is a fantastic project! Seriously something I've been wanting for a while..." - Erik L.

"...I starred this project earlier, but put it into the category "nice to have, but do I really NEED it". Just reassigned it to %#$!, MUST have. Keep up the good work, glad to be onboard." - Tim J.

"Awesome project! Simple and abstract. Love it." - Angie R.

"...I want the 1" for myself and the little ones [mini cubes] will be stocking stuffers for my two little ones (both will be future engineers :-)" - Greg

"Great project, less is more in this case." - Michael O.

"...There has been quite a bit of discussion around the choice of an appropriate centering object to present to the participants. I think this might satisfy most, if not all of the concerns of the group..." - Madeline T.

"...I'm pretty stoked about adding the Forged cube to my desk candy! ..." - Kyle H.

"Thanks for putting this project together -- I was one of the earlier backers and made a pledge immediately when I saw it.  Didn't know this disease had a name -- "metal junkie" :) ..." - Tom D.

If you want to shock yourself and others with pure density, please support the KILO cube and help me make it a reality.

Risks and challenges

We have built prototypes and have the manufacturing plan ready to go. 
Our biggest challenge is time; we have to coordinate all operations so we can fulfill all rewards in time.

story:
A first generation equestrian in my family, I have been on the back of a horse since age 5. Homeschooled from age 10 onward, I graduated high school online at age 13, giving me the opportunity to spend the majority of my time in the barn, where the real magic in my life emerged.  

My tireless passion since age 14, it was my dream to compete at the national horse showing level. Enduring the loss of several horses and a close friend/mentor as a teenager, I stayed devoted to my dreams for nine more years until the stars aligned in 2013.

Training my one year-old filly, Only By Grace (aka Lizzie), completely on my own, we flourished as a team in 2013 and were ready to take on the World Championship Show in Fort Worth, Texas.

With the help and sacrifices of my family, friends and fundraising in my community, I traveled to Texas in November 2013 and returned to my hometown of Willits, CA (also the hometown of the famous racehorse, Seabiscuit) a world champion.

Only by the grace of God am I able to say I've lived this amazing journey and was blessed with the little horse who made my dream come true, hence the inspiration behind Lizzie’s registered name, Only By Grace.

Now, I want to try and do it again, for myself, for my horse, and for all the people in my life who have always believed in me. 2015 is on the horizon, and I need y'alls help to cover travel expenses. Any donation is greatly appreciated!

Any donation is greatly appreciated!

story:
The Kampong Thom Housing Development Project is a pilot grassroots initiative that aims to provide the displaced people of Kampong Thom with access to the basic human rights of food, clean water and shelter.


The Human Rights Organization for Transparency and Peace (HROTP) in a non government organisation that provides free legal advice and assistance for disadvantaged Khmer people. HROTP represents human rights interests and anti-corruption issues, acting as a nonpartisan liaison group between the government and the Khmer people. As a group HROTP assists in a wide range of human rights cases, ranging from human trafficking and rape to enabling rural people have access to medical care in Phnom Penh and housing development projects for the underprivileged. 

In the late 1970s the Khmer Rouge banned private property, destroying thousands of land documents. As a result, many Cambodians lack the proper land titles to the property they own. This often results in the illegal sale or eviction of people from the lands that they rightfully own. The Cambodian government has been selling Cambodian people’s land to foreign investors for monetary gain with little regard for the land rights of the Cambodian people, taking away their homes and their livelihoods with little to no compensation. According to the rights group Licadho in 2013, 400 000 people have been affected by land grabbing and land disputes since 2003.

Kampong Thom Province

HROTP frequently visits the rural province of Kampong Thom, where we spend time working and documenting the land rights issues with the locals in Prey Lang Forest, a bio diverse forest that has been subject to extensive logging and mining. Land surrounding the forest has been sold to Vietnamese investors by the Cambodian government with little regard to the rights of the Khmer people. 700 families have been forced from their land with the promise of new land for housing and arable land for farming. Promises of adequate compensation have yet to be fulfilled. Multiple families have taken to living in one small home. They have lost their farms and no longer having the ability to earn an income, creating an inability to afford new housing. Many of the Cambodian people feel that the government has no regard for their well-being and they cannot see a solution to their struggle.

One Story

For several months HROTP has been working on developing a grassroots housing project in Senserei Mongkul village, which was inspired by one elderly woman and her family. This remarkable woman, Chhen Sopheap, and her family lost their home and land as a result of illegal land grabbing. They are currently living in wooden hut that is not much bigger than a single bedroom and does not have enough room to stand in. It is poorly built and low to the ground, having several times attracted poisonous snakes during the night. This hut is being lent to them on a short term basis by a neighbour and they live in constant fear of being asked to leave at any time. 

 The family are malnourished and often sick, Sopheap has been unable to see out of one eye and is too weak to walk very far or perform any type of hard labour. They have been attempting to make a small income through mending clothes, yet without a sewing machine they were rarely able to earn enough to buy even one meal of rice a day. This meant that they have had to rely on donations of food from the local villagers, creating a strain on an already impoverished community. The land on which they live now is rocky and largely infertile, so they are unable to even grow their own food. 

Sopheaps six year old granddaughter 


HROTPs Aim

HROTP wants to help this family to become self sustainable and have access to the basic human rights of adequate shelter, food and fresh water. By achieving this we will also be helping the local community as a whole, as it alleviates the strain placed on them by providing them with food and water. 

Through our fundraising campaign so far we have been able to provide Sopheap and her family with a sewing machine and the materials in which to mend and sew clothes, a small step on the road to self sufficiency. We have also secured a plot of arable land on which we aim to build the family a home and a well. 

What we need now are the funds with which to pay for the materials and labour associated with building them a home and digging the well. The cost of this has been quoted at $2000 US dollars. This money will make the world of difference for this family and the future prospects for the six year old granddaughter. But it does not stop with them, it will also make a huge difference to the community as a whole. Any contribution to this project, no matter how small, will have a lasting affect on the lives of the people of Kampong Thom. 

HROTP also aims to educate people and raise awareness about issues in Cambodia. Visit our website to find out about our other projects 

http://hrotp.org/

Please like us on Facebook and share one story of the many displaced families in the Kampong Thom province. Knowledge is power and the more people know about land rights abuse in Cambodia their greater the chance that we have to do something about it.

https://www.facebook.com/HROTP 

HROTP volunteers meeting with the family at their home in Kampong Thom

story:
About us

Hi there! My Name ist Alex. I am a mechanical engineer, a passionate diver and survival fan for more than 12 years. Since then I was looking for the perfect lamp to brighten up my adventures under water and above. Until now I was not able to find a lamp that would be able to match all of my needs. Some were bulky and clumsy whilst others simply did not have enough power. There was basically only one possible solution: "Do it yourself". With Michael, a specialist in LED lighting from the German company KölnLED, I sat together and planned the creation of this "one" lamp!

What are our plans?

Our goal is to build a lamp that outshines every single lamp on the market concerning power, functions and quality whilst at the same time still being affordable. The image you see above is our first design-concept and will hopefully not differ much from our final product. You can see the main specifications and functions in the following passage:

Specs and functions

  • 7x LED with up to 7280 Lumen
  • LCD Display that shows the battery lifetime and brightness
  • Rechargable batteries with 3Ah (larger ones in preparation)
  • One-Hand-Control for regulating the lamp
  • Multiple steps to adjust the brightness
  • SOS-Function
  • Replacable color filters for underwater fotography
  • Very light aluminium case in different colors
  • Usable underwater and above
  • Different lenses(10°, 25°, 40°) selectable (must be choosen during order)
  • Hook and eye for attaching the lamp
  • Easy to hold (2 Kg)

Comparison with other lamps

Why do we need your support?

A perfect product should match the need of every single customer and it is in our interest to create such a premium-quality device. I would love to say that German engineering skills itself guarantee the success of this project, but in fact it is not help in financing. After spending a long time and passion on this lamp, we feel the urge to finish what we once began and share our results with you! Until the day of completion you are invited to support us with your ideas, advice and donations!

What can we offer you?

Every donor receives our greatest possible appreciation! Unfortunately we can not send a lamp to every donor, which is the reason for grading the perks you receive. Regardless of the amount you donate, you will be named in the "book of supporters" which comes along with every lamp.

FAQ

  • How long do the batteries last?

    That depends on how bright you like it. With maximum power (7000 Lumen) and the small battery package the lamp will burn for one hour. Under normal conditions (1000 - 1500 Lumen) the lamp can be used for a few hours.

  • When will the lamp be finished?

    We are both full-time employees and can only work on the project in the evening. Since the concept is completed we hope to finish everything until the end of this year if financial support is given.

  • Can I use the lamp as a normal flashlight?

    Yes! The lamp was built for underwater purposes but can as well be used above sea level. An integrated controller will measure the temperature and in case of an emergency decrease the brightness to stop overheating.

  • Which accessories do I get?

    In the basic package you will receive the lamp, the charging station and a nylon bag. Additionally the following accessories can be purchased. Colorfilters (Color- and application suggestions desired), spare batteries (larger batteries in preparation) and a tough aluminium-suitcase which can hold all accessory parts.

  • How do we keep you up to date?

    All news on the lamp can be reviewed on this site. As soon as we progress in development we will inform you immediately ! We think of creating our own facebook site :)

  • Can I influence or support the developpment in any way?

    Yes! Simply send us your ideas and advice. We are pleased to hear from you!

Wer sind wir?

Hallo zusammen! Mein Name ist Alex. Ich bin Maschinenbauingenieur und seit 12 Jahren leidenschaftlicher Tauchsport und Survival Freund. Seit längerer Zeit bin ich nun auf der Suche nach der perfekten Lampe für meine Abenteuer unter- und oberhalb des Meeresspiegels. Bisher konnte mich jedoch keine der auf dem Markt angebotenen Lampen wirklich zufriedenstellen. Einige Lampen wirken plump und klobig und die anderen leuchten einfach nicht hell genug. Im Grunde genommen gab es nur eine mögliche Lösung: "Bau dir deine eigene Lampe". Zusammen mit Michael, einem Spezialisten für LED Technik der Firma KölnLED aus Bergisch Gladbach, haben wir uns zusammengesetzt um diese "eine" Lampe zu bauen!

Was haben wir vor?

Unser Ziel ist es, eine Lampe zu bauen, die alle anderen bisher da gewesenen Lampen, hinsichtlich Leistung und Funkionen, in den Schatten stellt und dennoch bezahlbar ist! Das Bild, welches oben zu sehen ist, stellt den ersten Design-Prototypen dar und wird sich vom fertigen Serienprodukt hoffentlich nicht all zu sehr unterscheiden. Die grundlegenden Spezifikationen und Funktionen der Lampe sind im folgenden Absatz zu finden.

Was soll die Lampe können?

  • 7-fach LED mit bis zu 7280 Lumen
  • LCD Display mit Anzeige der Batterielaufzeit und Helligkeit
  • Akkus mit 3Ah (größere in Vorbereitung)
  • Einhand-Regler zur Bedienung der Lampe
  • Mehrere Stufen zur Regelung der Helligkeit
  • SOS-Funktion
  • Einsetzbare Farbfilter für Unterwasserfotographie
  • Leichtes Aluminium Gehäuse in mehreren Farben wählbar
  • Verschiedene Linsengeometrien (10°, 25°, 40°) stehen zur Verfügung (Bei Bestellung anzugeben)
  • Über- und Unterwasser Betrieb
  • Haken und Öse zum befestigen der Lampe
  • Einfache Handhabung (2 Kg)

Vergleich mit anderen Lampen

Warum brauchen wir eure Hilfe?

Ein perfektes Produkt sollte JEDEN Kunden zufrieden stellen und somit möchten wir, auch aus eigenem Interesse, ein hochwertiges Produkt mit bestmöglicher Qualität entwickeln. Dennoch ist die Deutsche Ingenieurskunst nicht der einzige Garant für den Erfolg einer solchen Entwicklung! Nach jeder Menge Zeit und Herzblut, welches in dieses Projekt geflossen ist, möchten wir endlich unsere Ergebnisse sehen und mit Euch teilen. Bis zum fertigen Produkt seid Ihr also herzlich eingeladen uns mit euren Ideen, Ratschlägen und natürlich einer Spende zu unterstützen!

Was bieten wir euch?

Jeder Spender verdient von uns die größtmögliche Anerkennung! Leider können wir nicht an jeden Spender von einem Euro eine fertige Lampe verschenken, weshalb wir unsere Geschenke ein wenig staffeln müssen. Was wir aber jedem Spender garantieren, ist die namentliche Nennung in einem der Lampe beigelegten "Buch der Unterstützer".

Fragen und Antworten

  • Wie lange halten die Batterien der Lampe?

    Das kommt ganz darauf an, wie hell ihr es haben wollt. Auf maximaler Stufe (7200 Lumen) und mit dem kleinen Batteriepaket wird sie eine Laufzeit von einer Stunde haben. Bei normaler Benutzung (1000-1500 Lumen) wird sich die Laufzeit auf mehrere Stunden verlängern.

  • Wann wird die Lampe fertig sein?

    Wir sind beide voll berufstätig und können täglich in den Abendstunden an der Lampe arbeiten. Das Konzept ist fertig und somit hoffen wir, bei entsprechender Finanzierung, auf eine Fertigstellung vor Ende des Jahres.

  • Kann ich die Lampe auch über Wasser als Taschenlampe benutzen?

    Die Lampe wurde zwar als Unterwasser Lampe konstruiert, sie kann aber auch über Wasser betrieben werden. Eine integrierte Temperaturmessung regelt die Lampe bei Bedarf um ein Überhitzen zu vermeiden.

  • Was erhalte ich beim Kauf?

    Im Basis-Paket wird mit der Lampe eine Ladestation mitgeliefert und eine Nylontasche geliefert. Als weiteres Zubehör sind Farbfilter (Farb- und Anwendungsvorschläge erwünscht), Ersatzakkus (größere Akkus in Vorbereitung) und ein robuster und stoßfester Aluminium-Koffer erhältlich, in dem das gesamte Zubehör Platz findet.

  • Wie werden unsere Unterstützer auf dem laufenden gehalten?

    Alle Updates können hier auf der Seite nachgelesen werden. Sobald wir mit der Entwicklung weiterkommen, werdet ihr es natürlich als erste erfahren. Geplant ist zusätzlich die Erstellung einer eigenen Facebook Seite.

  • Kann ich selber noch Einfluss auf die Entwicklung der Lampe haben?

    Ja! Mit neuen Ideen und Ratschlägen könnt ihr uns bei dem gesamten Entstehungsprozess unterstützen.

About us
Hi there! My Name ist Alex. I am a mechanical engineer, a passionate diver and survival fan for more than 12 years. Since then I was looking for the perfect lamp to brighten up my adventures under water and above. Until now I was not able to find a lamp that would be able to match all of my needs. Some were bulky and clumsy whilst others simply did not have enough power. There was basically only one possible solution: "Do it yourself". With Michael, a specialist in LED lighting from the German company KölnLED, I sat together and planned the creation of this "one" lamp!
What are our plans?
Our goal is to build a lamp that outshines every single lamp on the market concerning power, functions and quality whilst at the same time still being affordable. The image you see above is our first design-concept and will hopefully not differ much from our final product. You can see the main specifications and functions in the following passage:
Specs and functions

7x LED with up to 7280 Lumen
LCD Display that shows the battery lifetime and brightness
Rechargable batteries with 3Ah (larger ones in preparation)
One-Hand-Control for regulating the lamp
Multiple steps to adjust the brightness
SOS-Function
Replacable color filters for underwater fotography
Very light aluminium case in different colors
Usable underwater and above
Different lenses(10°, 25°, 40°) selectable (must be choosen during order)
Hook and eye for attaching the lamp
Easy to hold (2 Kg)

Comparison with other lamps

Why do we need your support?
A perfect product should match the need of every single customer and it is in our interest to create such a premium-quality device. I would love to say that German engineering skills itself guarantee the success of this project, but in fact it is not help in financing. After spending a long time and passion on this lamp, we feel the urge to finish what we once began and share our results with you! Until the day of completion you are invited to support us with your ideas, advice and donations!
What can we offer you?
Every donor receives our greatest possible appreciation! Unfortunately we can not send a lamp to every donor, which is the reason for grading the perks you receive. Regardless of the amount you donate, you will be named in the "book of supporters" which comes along with every lamp.
FAQ


How long do the batteries last?
 That depends on how bright you like it. With maximum power (7000 Lumen) and the small battery package the lamp will burn for one hour. Under normal conditions (1000 - 1500 Lumen) the lamp can be used for a few hours. 


When will the lamp be finished?
 We are both full-time employees and can only work on the project in the evening. Since the concept is completed we hope to finish everything until the end of this year if financial support is given. 


Can I use the lamp as a normal flashlight?
 Yes! The lamp was built for underwater purposes but can as well be used above sea level. An integrated controller will measure the temperature and in case of an emergency decrease the brightness to stop overheating. 


Which accessories do I get?
 In the basic package you will receive the lamp, the charging station and a nylon bag. Additionally the following accessories can be purchased. Colorfilters (Color- and application suggestions desired), spare batteries (larger batteries in preparation) and a tough aluminium-suitcase which can hold all accessory parts. 


How do we keep you up to date?
 All news on the lamp can be reviewed on this site. As soon as we progress in development we will inform you immediately ! We think of creating our own facebook site :) 


Can I influence or support the developpment in any way?
 Yes! Simply send us your ideas and advice. We are pleased to hear from you! 










Wer sind wir?
Hallo zusammen! Mein Name ist Alex. Ich bin Maschinenbauingenieur und seit 12 Jahren leidenschaftlicher Tauchsport und Survival Freund. Seit längerer Zeit bin ich nun auf der Suche nach der perfekten Lampe für meine Abenteuer unter- und oberhalb des Meeresspiegels. Bisher konnte mich jedoch keine der auf dem Markt angebotenen Lampen wirklich zufriedenstellen. Einige Lampen wirken plump und klobig und die anderen leuchten einfach nicht hell genug. Im Grunde genommen gab es nur eine mögliche Lösung: "Bau dir deine eigene Lampe". Zusammen mit Michael, einem Spezialisten für LED Technik der Firma KölnLED aus Bergisch Gladbach, haben wir uns zusammengesetzt um diese "eine" Lampe zu bauen!
Was haben wir vor?
Unser Ziel ist es, eine Lampe zu bauen, die alle anderen bisher da gewesenen Lampen, hinsichtlich Leistung und Funkionen, in den Schatten stellt und dennoch bezahlbar ist! Das Bild, welches oben zu sehen ist, stellt den ersten Design-Prototypen dar und wird sich vom fertigen Serienprodukt hoffentlich nicht all zu sehr unterscheiden. Die grundlegenden Spezifikationen und Funktionen der Lampe sind im folgenden Absatz zu finden.
Was soll die Lampe können?

7-fach LED mit bis zu 7280 Lumen
LCD Display mit Anzeige der Batterielaufzeit und Helligkeit
Akkus mit 3Ah (größere in Vorbereitung)
Einhand-Regler zur Bedienung der Lampe
Mehrere Stufen zur Regelung der Helligkeit
SOS-Funktion
Einsetzbare Farbfilter für Unterwasserfotographie
Leichtes Aluminium Gehäuse in mehreren Farben wählbar
Verschiedene Linsengeometrien (10°, 25°, 40°) stehen zur Verfügung (Bei Bestellung anzugeben)
Über- und Unterwasser Betrieb
Haken und Öse zum befestigen der Lampe
Einfache Handhabung (2 Kg)

Vergleich mit anderen Lampen

Warum brauchen wir eure Hilfe?
Ein perfektes Produkt sollte JEDEN Kunden zufrieden stellen und somit möchten wir, auch aus eigenem Interesse, ein hochwertiges Produkt mit bestmöglicher Qualität entwickeln. Dennoch ist die Deutsche Ingenieurskunst nicht der einzige Garant für den Erfolg einer solchen Entwicklung! Nach jeder Menge Zeit und Herzblut, welches in dieses Projekt geflossen ist, möchten wir endlich unsere Ergebnisse sehen und mit Euch teilen. Bis zum fertigen Produkt seid Ihr also herzlich eingeladen uns mit euren Ideen, Ratschlägen und natürlich einer Spende zu unterstützen!
Was bieten wir euch?
Jeder Spender verdient von uns die größtmögliche Anerkennung! Leider können wir nicht an jeden Spender von einem Euro eine fertige Lampe verschenken, weshalb wir unsere Geschenke ein wenig staffeln müssen. Was wir aber jedem Spender garantieren, ist die namentliche Nennung in einem der Lampe beigelegten "Buch der Unterstützer".
Fragen und Antworten


Wie lange halten die Batterien der Lampe?
 Das kommt ganz darauf an, wie hell ihr es haben wollt. Auf maximaler Stufe (7200 Lumen) und mit dem kleinen Batteriepaket wird sie eine Laufzeit von einer Stunde haben. Bei normaler Benutzung (1000-1500 Lumen) wird sich die Laufzeit auf mehrere Stunden verlängern. 


Wann wird die Lampe fertig sein?
 Wir sind beide voll berufstätig und können täglich in den Abendstunden an der Lampe arbeiten. Das Konzept ist fertig und somit hoffen wir, bei entsprechender Finanzierung, auf eine Fertigstellung vor Ende des Jahres. 


Kann ich die Lampe auch über Wasser als Taschenlampe benutzen?
 Die Lampe wurde zwar als Unterwasser Lampe konstruiert, sie kann aber auch über Wasser betrieben werden. Eine integrierte Temperaturmessung regelt die Lampe bei Bedarf um ein Überhitzen zu vermeiden. 


Was erhalte ich beim Kauf?
 Im Basis-Paket wird mit der Lampe eine Ladestation mitgeliefert und eine Nylontasche geliefert. Als weiteres Zubehör sind Farbfilter (Farb- und Anwendungsvorschläge erwünscht), Ersatzakkus (größere Akkus in Vorbereitung) und ein robuster und stoßfester Aluminium-Koffer erhältlich, in dem das gesamte Zubehör Platz findet. 


Wie werden unsere Unterstützer auf dem laufenden gehalten?
 Alle Updates können hier auf der Seite nachgelesen werden. Sobald wir mit der Entwicklung weiterkommen, werdet ihr es natürlich als erste erfahren. Geplant ist zusätzlich die Erstellung einer eigenen Facebook Seite. 


Kann ich selber noch Einfluss auf die Entwicklung der Lampe haben?
 Ja! Mit neuen Ideen und Ratschlägen könnt ihr uns bei dem gesamten Entstehungsprozess unterstützen.

story: The problem is that we are really strapped for cash and don't know how we can afford to get married. so with that being said we were just wondering if anyone has the heart to help us out. All cash raised will help us start our journey with the best day of our lives... our wedding. Hope you can help anything will help weather it be ten or one hundred. Thank you much for your time.

story:
When craftsmanship meets charity in connection with Easter something exceptional must uprise. „If you see charity, you see the Trinity“ - Saint Augustine*. 
(De Trinitate, VIII, 8, 12: CCL 50, 287.)

Translation Links

German | Italiano | Russian | Portogese | Spanish | Japanese | Chinese | Korean

Prefix

The campaign will lead to the creation of an extra ordinary clock that can both display and mechanically calculate the Easter Date of the Georgian Calendar. (Roman Catholic Easter Date). We, Archides Uhren in Salzburg, have created a project, that is dedicated to the 12 Apostles, however ...

this specific campaign at Indiegogo is dedicated to Saint Peter, also known as Simon Peter, leader of the early Christian Church; within the Roman Catholic Church considered as the first Pope and founder of the Church in Rome.

Therefore , the sole location of the „Saint Peter Clock” will be in Rome! – The one person responsible for it – is the Pope!

Participate in Pope Present is the title, and it should be your passion to make it happen.

Pope Francis is known to be charitable - and so are we. We guarantee that proceeds above the funding goal will be donated to charity. Please see FAQ's for our thoughts which project should be supported.


Brief historical Overview

Since clocks started being made there are only a few clocks known capable of calculating Easter Date mechanically; in his famous horological work "Tractatus Astrarii" Giovanni Dondi (1318 - 1389) described and illustrated a planetary clock with a calendar device indicating the Easter and other related feasts. Dondi was the first to think about the possibility to calculate the Easter Date mechanically. Such computus can be found on the Strasbourg Cathedral astronomical clock. Jens Olson, a Danish engineer, implemented the Easter date within his famous Astronomical Clock, which can be seen at Copenhagen City Hall. Patek PhilippeTM constructed such computus on occassion of their 150th anniversary (Caliber 89). These are the best known examples so far.

All clocks have limitations concerning the duration of calculation without human intervention. The biggest difference to our clock!

Religious clocks have been around since ancient times. As early as the epoch of clepsydras and gnomons, resourceful clergy learned to adapt the time measuring instruments for the purposes of time-programmed control of religious ceremonial rites and rituals. The union of astronomy, religion and mechanics must still be seen as the peak of clockmaking, that only a few men in history reached.

Today only a few clockmakers can meet the challenge of inventing something radically new in horology. This requires an offbeat scientific and practical approach and profound knowledge of horology, past and present. Dozens of pages covered with complex mathematical and astronomical calculations testify to the enormous work Konstantin Chaykin had to accomplish while developing this complication. It took him years to create the unique movement of the astronomical clocks "Easter Time". Konstantin Chaykin also created calendars for the Orthodox Easter date, an Islamic and Jewish calendar.

The Clock

 - The Clock Movement

  • 1 month duration
  • Vibration frequency of the balance 18.000 bph
  • Hour, minute, and second indication 
  • Perpetual Calendar (displaying the date, month, as well as the days of week, the year and the leap year
  • Lunar pahses indication
  • Leap year display
  • Easter Date display with one hand
  • Power reserve indicator
  • Replacement part for the disc change in about 100 years


 - The Clock Design

The design is clearly from the 21st century and yet it is timeless. It is the Celtic symbol for Trinity in a modern shape.

In any case, the clock presents itself as something special and at first sight stands out clear and recognizable to all other clocks. All 14 pieces (see "The whole project") will be produced similarly, but have names and colour specific distinctions. Similarly the material (Olive wood and Makassar) of the clock case is special and symbolic.

Regarding the Celtic Trinity the three-part case was developed with a nicely curved line, that has neither a beginning or an end. This refers subtly to TIME and its measurement. The wing elements represents visually the focus of the clock and are massively formed by 14 lamellae. These are 8 mm wide, and are symbolic of the 12 Apostles and the two additional Evangelists.

Each Apostle receives his own name engraving, on his special lamellae.

All indicators on the clock will be in latin, and so will the names of the Apostles: Simon Petrus, Andreas, Iacobus Zebedaei, Iohannes, Philippus, Bartholomeus, Thomas, Mattheus publicanus, Iacobus Alphei, Thaddeus, Simon Cananeus and Matthias (Acts 1:15-26). The names are shown within the individual made lamellae.

Besides this explanation of the Celtic Trinity, the other kind of infinity symbol we can also see with some fantasy - the fish. Again, there are three different ways to view this special design.


The whole project - Apostle Clocks

(Please keep in mind, that the Saint Peter Clock is part of the whole Apostle Clock project, and only the Saint Peter Clock is refered to for this campaign.)

The project, "Apostle Clocks", is based on the production of 14 clocks (12 certified Apostles Clocks and two prototypes named after the two evangelists who are not Apostles (Lucas and Marcus) - these two men are symbolically represented within the design by the border lamellae. These two "extra" clocks will be used for show around the globe at interested museums.

For obvious reasons we decided to create a project with the Apostles. The Catholic Easter Date, the blessing urbi et orbi, the first Apostle Petrus and several other meaningful reasons made it obvious to donate the Petrus Clock to the Vatican. The other Apostle Clocks are favourable opportunities for people of faith and art collectors.

To finance this project with a crowd-funding campaign, we wanted to keep the possibilities for all to be part in this project and to glorify His Holiness Pope Francis, Bishop of Rome, Vicar of Jesus Christ, Successor of the Prince of the Apostles, Supreme Pontiff of the Universal Church - the Holy See, Primate of Italy, Archbishop and Metropolitan of the Roman Province, Sovereign of the Vatican City State, Servant of the servants of God.

Persons Involved

Konstantin Chaykin (Owner of Konstantin Chaykin Manufacture in Moscow, Russia and owner of 38 patents. Member of the famous AHCI) created a mechanical calculus (patent pending) hand in hand with a perfect moon and a perpetual calendar - first human interaction is needed on February 29th 2100, and than again 200 years later.

His invention was the reason why we (Archides Uhren GmbH in Salzburg) wanted to create a special clock for the Holy Father - with an appropriate and matching design. This design was developed by Robert Blaschke (Owner & Creative Head of Raumbau Architekten Salzburg, Austria). Responsible for the design realisation will be Wolfgang Wochner (Owner of Josef Wochner GmbH & Co. KG in Heiligenzimmern , Germany).

The idea, the concept, and the organisation is done by Archides Uhren in Salzburg, respectively in a legal form of a charitable association. (pictures from left: The brothers Klaus & Mag. Gerhard Messerklinger). Responsible for the idea and all words.

Responsible for the treasury within the charitable association is lawyer and Knight of the Holy Sepulchre RA Dr. Johannes Neumann (Junior Partner at PEHB - Pressl Endl Heinrich Bamberger Rechtsanwälte GmbH - Salzburg, Austria). Link to the Articles of Association and our promise. (Vereinsstatuten only in German).


This text has been edited by Scarlett de Bontin, an American who lives in Salzburg, Austria.

YOU: Please feel free to share us with all your contacts via social networks.

Thank you for all your support. All major supporters will be named here and in the clock enclosed book. (see also Book as Perk!)


FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

Contributions, Payment, & Delivery

Can I donate direct?

Please see detailed informations on our homepage, resp. on the about | impress page.

How do I purchase another Apostle Clock?

When you choose Perk A - Reserve one of the other 11 Apostle Clocks, this only means that you have bought a reservation! and the right to choose from one of the Apostle names. We will work in the sense of: “first come, first serve principle.” You should contact us after buying this Perk, to reserve your name. We will also update regularly the list of the available names - so please see the update site.

According the the regulations on Indiegogo, we will an have fulfilled the agreement, by accepting the reservation. If - and only if, you don’t come up with the instalment plan, your reservation will be passed on to someone else.

For your better understanding: We, the Private Association “Saint Peter Clock” pass on the reservation to Archides Uhren GmbH. From that time all business activities are made by Archides Uhren GmbH in Salzburg, Austria. The amount paid at Indiegogo must be seen as donation and is therefore non-refundable.

Are there other payment to receive another Apostle Clock?

Yes, the payment in Perk A is only a reservation fee - or the part, which supports the amount of the Saint Peter Clock. There will be further payments. Approximately around 250 K US$, depending how many clocks will be ordered, if individual wishes are mentioned, and so on.

Please send us an Email and we will send you more detailed informations about this agreement and the payment plan.

Other Apostle Clock: What will happen when I don’t pay the further payments?

Then you will loose your payment. We will write to you several times, at least 3 times, but when the payments does not come, you will loose your payment. The payment at Perk A is a non-refundable payment! - if you does not come up the agreed goals.

Will there be added delivery costs or VAT? 

No, we have calculated all prices including these fees. The only added fee, the customs duty and if exist taxes in your country, will be added to the Apostle Clocks. But we will discuss this, as soon as you bought this Perk.

Will you keep me updated with the progress if I contribute?

Yes! When you contribute to the Saint Peter Clock campaign we will ensure that you receive all the latest information about all project’s products as they progresses.

I had problems making a contribution, please help?

If you faced problems when making a contribution, please check common contribution errors. (http://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/...)

I made a contribution, but now I've changed my mind. Can I have my money back?

Contributions on Indiegogo are non-refundable according to the Indiegogo Terms of Use. (https://www.indiegogo.com/about/terms). A contribution is a transaction that takes place purely between the contributor, campaign owner and payment processor. Our Association does not refund any contributions made. Read more from the Indiegogo Help Center. (http://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/...).

Availability & Products

When will you ship the products?

Assuming to the reached funds and the structure of the products bought, we will be delivering the first products in the first quarter of 2015. In any event, we will keep you updated on the schedule in our update emails.

Can the product features or specifications change before delivery?

As in any crowdfunding campaign, changes are possible. We reserve the right to make changes in described features, specifications, and delivery date estimates, and to introduce other features and functionality at a later date.

How will the products look like?

The Postcard: We have planned to create a motive according to the project - and it should combine somehow Rome, the Holy Father and the Saint Peter Clock. We will ask some artists to do it for us and therefore we can not describe it better at this time. On the back we will print some Thank you text and of course your address. When all is done, we will print the postcards in Salzburg, Austria, then we will travel to Rome, stick on Vatican stamps (hopefully we can organise stamps showing Pope Francis) and send them from Vatican State.

The Clock Book: The book will cover the topics of the project, the design, the clock movement, and of course the Easter Date and its history. But we also include a chapter with the technical product description. Last but not least a chapter with the involved people and a chapter with all the supporters, individuals, institutions, associations and companies. (see Perks)

Example: [Individuals Chapter] - [Country] - John Doe, London. - In the same way we will list all other too.

Others

Why should you support us?

You will be part of an open, globally unique present for the Pope. The present itself will be unique too, to its functionality. We want to challenge the high research, development and design costs and show that community, innovation and passion can make this dream and project come true.

What will we do with your money?

Our goal is to fund the Petrus Clock as a present for the Pope. (We already have been given permission to bring the Holy Father the clock from his office.) As mentioned above, we want to be charitable, as the Holy Father is known.

Motivated by our own family we would like to give the extending funding to children. We would like to give it to a known organisation, to children and to an area which can not be supported enough in the next days - so we would like to give the surplus funds to SOS Children Villages appropriated to Syria.

We hope you will support this reasons and decision.

Which amount will be donated to the charitable project?

Our prime goal is to fund the Pope present. The proceeds above will be donated. The main costs of the project are already calculated, but depending on the Perks bought, some costs could still be calculated.

Why have you founded an Association for this project?

Briefly. Crowd-funding is well known in Austria, but the government, respectively the financial legislation, have not respond to this internet business. This is why we founded an Association. We hope, that this circumstance will be changed in the near future.

My question wasn't answered in this campaign page, what to do?

If you have more questions or simply just want to know the Association and / or the company Archides (project coordinator) better, don’t hesitate to send us an (mailto: spc@gmail.com) visit our website at wordpress.com (http://paspc.wordpress.com) or the website of Archides (http://www.archides.at).

Damages caused by force majeure, riot, revolution, war or natural phenomena, or whether [...]

We, Saint Peter Clock Association, can not be held responsible for damages caused by force majeure, rebellion, military or civil coup, revolt, uproar, riot, blockade, embargo, government act, sabotage (thinking of the Ukraine Crisis as example), nor in the event of death or massive disease or injury of the clockmaker.

In such cases (mainly in combination with Perk A) contributors will have the right to reverse the contract.

We will work in the sense of: “first come, first serve principle.” You should contact us after buying this Perk, to reserve your name. We will also update regularly the list of the available names - so please see the update site.
According the the regulations on Indiegogo, we will an have fulfilled the agreement, by accepting the reservation. If - and only if, you don’t come up with the instalment plan, your reservation will be passed on to someone else.
For your better understanding: We, the Private Association “Saint Peter Clock” pass on the reservation to Archides Uhren GmbH. From that time all business activities are made by Archides Uhren GmbH in Salzburg, Austria. The amount paid at Indiegogo must be seen as donation and is therefore non-refundable.

Are there other payment to receive another Apostle Clock?

Yes, the payment in Perk A is only a reservation fee - or the part, which supports the amount of the Saint Peter Clock. There will be further payments. Approximately around 250 K US$, depending how many clocks will be ordered, if individual wishes are mentioned, and so on.
Please send us an Email and we will send you more detailed informations about this agreement and the payment plan.
 
Other Apostle Clock: What will happen when I don’t pay the further payments?
Then you will loose your payment. We will write to you several times, at least 3 times, but when the payments does not come, you will loose your payment. The payment at Perk A is a non-refundable payment! - if you does not come up the agreed goals.
Will there be added delivery costs or VAT? 
No, we have calculated all prices including these fees. The only added fee, the customs duty and if exist taxes in your country, will be added to the Apostle Clocks. But we will discuss this, as soon as you bought this Perk.
Will you keep me updated with the progress if I contribute? 

Yes! When you contribute to the Saint Peter Clock campaign we will ensure that you receive all the latest information about all project’s products as they progresses.

I had problems making a contribution, please help?  
If you faced problems when making a contribution, please check common contribution errors. (http://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/...)
I made a contribution, but now I've changed my mind. Can I have my money back?
Contributions on Indiegogo are non-refundable according to the Indiegogo Terms of Use. (https://www.indiegogo.com/about/terms).  A contribution is a transaction that takes place purely between the contributor, campaign owner and payment processor. Our Association does not refund any contributions made. Read more from the Indiegogo Help Center. (http://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/...).
Availability & Products
When will you ship the products?
Assuming to the reached funds and the structure of the products bought, we will be delivering the first products in the first quarter of 2015. In any event, we will keep you updated on the schedule in our update emails.

Can the product features or specifications change before delivery?
As in any crowdfunding campaign, changes are possible. We reserve the right to make changes in described features, specifications, and delivery date estimates, and to introduce other features and functionality at a later date.
How will the products look like?
The Postcard: We have planned to create a motive according to the project - and it should combine somehow Rome, the Holy Father and the Saint Peter Clock. We will ask some artists to do it for us and therefore we can not describe it better at this time. On the back we will print some Thank you text and of course your address. When all is done, we will print the postcards in Salzburg, Austria, then we will travel to Rome, stick on Vatican stamps (hopefully we can organise stamps showing Pope Francis) and send them from Vatican State.
The Clock Book: The book will cover the topics of the project, the design, the clock movement, and of course the Easter Date and its history. But we also include a chapter with the technical product description. Last but not least a chapter with the involved people and a chapter with all the supporters, individuals, institutions, associations and companies. (see Perks)
Example: [Individuals Chapter] - [Country] - John Doe, London. - In the same way we will list all other too.
Others
Why should you support us?
You will be part of an open, globally unique present for the Pope. The present itself will be unique too, to its functionality. We want to challenge the high research, development and design costs and show that community, innovation and passion can make this dream and project come true.
What will we do with your money?

Our goal is to fund the Petrus Clock as a present for the Pope. (We already have been given permission to bring the Holy Father the clock from his office.) As mentioned above, we want to be charitable, as the Holy Father is known.
Motivated by our own family we would like to give the extending funding to children. We would like to give it to a known organisation, to children and to an area which can not be supported enough in the next days - so we would like to give the surplus funds to SOS Children Villages appropriated to Syria.
We hope you will support this reasons and decision.
Which amount will be donated to the charitable project?
Our prime goal is to fund the Pope present. The proceeds above will be donated. The main costs of the project are already calculated, but depending on the Perks bought, some costs could still be calculated.
Why have you founded an Association for this project?
Briefly. Crowd-funding is well known in Austria, but the government, respectively the financial legislation, have not respond to this internet business. This is why we founded an Association. We hope, that this circumstance will be changed in the near future.
My question wasn't answered in this campaign page, what to do?
If you have more questions or simply just want to know the Association and / or the company Archides (project coordinator) better, don’t hesitate to send us an (mailto: spc@gmail.com) visit our website at wordpress.com (http://paspc.wordpress.com) or the website of Archides (http://www.archides.at).
Damages  caused by force majeure, riot, revolution, war or natural phenomena, or whether [...]

We, Saint Peter Clock Association, can not be held responsible for damages caused by force majeure, rebellion, military or civil coup, revolt, uproar, riot, blockade, embargo, government act, sabotage (thinking of the Ukraine Crisis as example), nor in the event of death or massive disease or injury of the clockmaker.
In such cases (mainly in combination with Perk A) contributors will have the right to reverse the contract.

story:
The Mi Garden is a self-contained, indoor grow system that allows anyone to grow fresh herbs, vegetables or flowers, regardless of the weather outside and regardless of any previous experience you’ve had growing plants. 

Innovation

Technology has replaced the need for a "Green-Thumb"!  This truly innovative, high quality, indoor grow system is not only push-button easy to operate, it's also affordable for everyone. And unlike the herb gardens that you often see for sale, this system is designed for real-world use to continuously produce an abundance of fresh food.

The Mi Garden is a complete product with an integrated grow light, automatic watering system and an intuitive, easy to use micro-controller that handles all of the watering and light timing so that you can literally leave the system for days at a time and your plants will continue to thrive.

The micro-controller interface was designed for ease of use and mistake free growing.  The left side of the controller allows you to choose from – Vegetables, Herbs, Flowers or Others and the right side allows you to set – Seeding, Growing or Ripening.  After those settings are selected, the system handles all of the hard work for you; you simply need to monitor water and nutrient levels occasionally.

What Will You Grow? 

We have been testing the system prototypes for many months and during that time we’ve grown everything from Flowers, to Herbs, Tomatoes, Lettuce and different types of Peppers.  And during this testing we’ve meticulously refined the system programs to produce the optimum growing conditions for the largest variety of plants.

With the Mi Garden, you can start with seeds or transplants and you can manipulate your plants into blooming multiple times per year as opposed to the single bloom cycle that occurs outdoors with natural sunlight.  This means fresh food all year long and this is all done at the push of a button.

After your plants have grown for a certain period of time and/or reached a certain height, you can simply select the “Ripening” option.  This forces the plants to start the cycle of blooming so that you have 100% control.    

Two Options 

The first is a unit that comes with a florescent grow light. This light works amazingly well but since it’s already mass produced, it’s a lower cost option and it’s much cheaper to replace.  The monthly electricity costs for this option will be no more than $4, depending on where you live.

The second, yet most innovative option is one that features a proprietary LED grow light.   By using LED's we're able to produce only the specific spectrum of light that plants need for photosynthesis.   This light can last for up to 7 years and it uses far less energy so it makes for a much more eco-friendly product.  The monthly electricity costs for this option are negligible, you will barely notice an increase.

Design

This system has been designed to be minimalist yet modern, so that it can literally be the centerpiece of any room and fit nicely with almost any home décor.  Though the system can grow 6 plants up to almost 2 feet tall, it’s also compact enough to be easily tucked away into any small, or unused space.

Why This Project?

My goal with this project is pretty simple – Create a product that makes people happy, more self-reliant, and delivers more quality, ease of use and satisfaction than the user expected!

This isn’t just an idea or a concept that I’m asking you to back, this is something that I’ve backed with everything I have and that I believe in 100%.  I've put my heart and soul into getting this product to the point it's at and I truly believe that it's something people will love!

In order to get this product off the ground, we need to make modifications to our molds and make some final changes to the design.  We also need to meet a minimum production run in order to have the product manufactured.   And that’s why I’m asking for your pledge.  I need one final push to truly get this product launched and to create an incredible community of urban, indoor growers.

As a backer of this project, you are getting a Huge discount off of the price the unit will retail for, and depending on your pledge option, you will receive a final production model Mi Garden System. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out this project, sharing it with friends and family and also for your consideration in Joining me in reaching this goal!

 

 

 Perks

The perks that include a final production model Mi Garden Grow systems do not include shipping.  Shipping costs will be extra and will need to be determined based on your location.

story:
Thank you for all your support and prayer to fund this project.  We will close on the mission house Nov. 19.  We have a lot of work to do and still need your support to finish this project.

Follow our twitter to see what's happening now.  We will keep you updated with the progress as we move forward.

Mission Bus Team

 

///////////////////////////////////////////

 

Short Summary

MISSIONBUS works with homeless and families near homelessness.

MISSIONBUS is a family team of 9 people that travel the country loving and helping people that live on the streets as homeless. The team has traveled 10,000+ miles from Boston to San Francisco in a school bus we converted with the help of friends and family into an rolling mission command center loving people all along the way in 19 major US cities experiencing significant homelessness. MISSIONBUS is raising funds to purchase an old farm house to rehab for local mission work and create a base station to run national missions.

What We Need

MISSIONBUS needs a home base to coordinate local and national mission work.

MISSIONBUS is in need of a mission base to dock MISSIONBUS and need a base station for local Community work we do with families that are in need.  MISSIONBUS helps families get back on track after the struggles of the world have beat them down and created a chasm they just can't get out of on their own.  MISSIONBUS comes along side of the struggling family and we walk with them out of bondage into freedom.  We do whatever it takes to facilitate this process.  Provide a place to stay away from home as we rehab their home, organize their living spaces, do laundry, do dishes, help get normal processes working again.  The father is key in this process, restoration and recovery must come from the leader of the family.  We assist the father in this process through encouragement and establishing accountability throughout the family unit.

How the money will be allocated:

Purchase of the property and farm house              $17,000
New well, plumbing, roof, inside repairs                 $16,000 

Total                                                                 $34,000


TAX deductible contribution

In partnership with Words To Works Ministries, Inc. 501(c)3 of Jacksonville, FL, your contribution to help MissionBus is tax deductible.


What You Get

We love to make cool stuff for you with our hands.

Besides knowing you've helped MISSIONBUS restore families and love people on the streets of America, we are busy making some really neat perks for you to keep or give as gifts.  We are offering homemade custom Thank You cards, custom friendship bracelets, a music cd of live gospel music produced by the MISSIONBUS band.  You can also get a website for your family or business.  We will custom develop your site with additional options to search optimize the website for Google search.  

The Impact

MISSIONBUS makes a difference in people's lives.

MISSIONBUS has traveled the country for the last two years and learned so much about people that live on the streets.  We have listened to their stories and spent time with them under the bridges, in the woods and on the streets.  Each one of them has a name and a unique story.  Our mission is to show people that they do matter and that someone does care about them.  Many of these stories start with normal families trying to make it in the world but as life happens many struggles lead to oppression and then depression.  Our team has a deep love for people to help them off of this path that can lead eventually to homelessness.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out!

Maybe you can't contribute but you have lots of friends that might be interested in our perks or mission.  Tell a friend about us and if they contribute to our mission, we will send you a friendship bracelet.

story:
Welcome To Our Wedding! 

Thank you so much for visiting! Thank you to all our friends and family for your support over the years. We are so grateful to have everyone in our lives. 

Our wedding will be taking place in beautiful London, Ontario. We have always loved the outdoors and a good glass of wine so we couldn't think of a better place to celebrate this special occasion. So mark your calendars because we would love for you to come celebrate with us!

We can not wait for this wonderful day and we hope you will join us in each step we take as we become husband and wife. We are looking to raise funds for our wedding. In exchange for a homemade gift or in lieu of a wedding gift help us fund our BIG day! 


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise 2,500 dollars to go directly to the cost of our wedding. All products are handmade with love by Chris and Steph. Contact us if your perk is not listed! 
Here is what we offer:
Chocolates (package of 6) = $ 3
Grocery Tote = $ 3
Greeting Cards = $ 4
Jam = $ 4
Pickles = $ 5
Salsa or Pasta Sauce = $ 5
Peanut Butter 500ml = $ 5
Yogurt 500ml = $ 5
Baked Goods (cookies, muffins, granola bars, etc) = $ 5
Bread, Buns and Bagels = $ 6
Appetizers (spring rolls, samosas, perogies) = $ 7 *
Pies = $ 7
Tealight Package of 12 = $ 9
Tutu = $ 10
Home Grown Vegetables (Full Grocery Bag)= $ 10 *
Piñata = $ 10
Votives Package of 6 = $ 15
Advent Calendar = # 15
Cork Birdhouse = $ 20
Cake (depending on size/decorating) = $ 20 +  ?
Personalized Canvas Art = $ 25
Personalized Photobooks or Calendars = Please Inquire
Personalized Wooden Growth Chart = $ 35
Customized Wooden Signs = $ 40
Date Night ( 3 course meal with wine) = $ 50 *
Painted Wooden Alphabet Blocks = $ 75
Teacher Classroom Decorations (Please Inquire)
Wine (We could either make a batch or you can try ours, please inquire) 
* Only available for delivery in Edmonton or Calgary
For general items on the list, please inquire as to what you are looking for. Some items do not include shipping. If you require multiple items, please add them together, and notify us of your required items.

If there are any other ideas that you have, please let us know! These items include:

-Items for special occasions. Ie. Wedding invitations, save the date cards, birthday decorations etc.

-other crafts! (know something you want made! We can likely do it!)

story:
WATCH AND PREPARE YOURSELF TO BE AMAZED. Decorate the world with MagnaHang – the REVOLUTIONARY new tool for decorating with ornaments, garland, ribbon, streamers and more.


MagnaHang ™ is a patent pending magnetic hanging apparatus that can be used to hang objects in various fashionable occasions, the primary of which being holiday ornaments. The product is a versatile hanger that is magnetically attractive, and can be applied to any area that contains metal including: drywall and paneling screws, nails, metal corners, door frames, walls, ceilings, and so much more. With the application of the additional Backer Magnet, MagnaHang can be applied to non-metallic items such as: lampshades, curtains, table cloths, glass in windows and doors, and pretty much whatever your creativity allows.

PRODUCT / TEAM MEMBERS

John Glover – Former small businessman, entrepreneur-inventor, patent holder and majority owner of MagnaHang. Age 42. John resides in Wildwood, New Jersey with his wife Celeste where they enjoy life with their young daughter.

Scott Reese – He concurrently serves as the Strategic Planner for MagnaHang. Age 56. As frequent flyer of the United States, Scott lives in Vacaville, California with his wife Jeanie where they raised their three children.

Michele Esposito - Currently, as small business owner with 25 years of Retail Management & 10 years of  Information Technology Sales.  Michele is our Executive Assistant and lives with her family in Mays Landing, NJ. Age 53.

MagnaHang’s initial marketing will be directed towards the display of holiday decorations and ornaments. The product can be used for decorating Christmas trees as well as applying holiday decorations around the home, office, or business in a wide variety of areas. MagnaHangs are safer than traditional ornament hooks because they are more visible and will not embed themselves in carpet, as what occurs with traditional ornament hooks that pose choking hazards to infants, children and animals. A wide variety of alternate, non-holiday uses for MagnaHang have been identified, which will be marketed as well. These applications include corporate branding items such as “365” decorations, easy and invisible temporary hanging of privacy screens, room dividers, signs, advertising banners and low-voltage accent lighting and more.

Other year-round applications for MagnaHang include drying flowers, hanging vines for plants, or for creating elegant ways to hang easily misplaced items such as: keys, jewelry or eyeglasses. MagnaHang is a new way of decorating and displaying items that are quick and easy to remove, relocate, and store. 

Restaurants, bars, retail stores, professional offices, hospitals, cultural halls, casinos, department stores and classrooms can all be seasonally decorated with ease and safety. Even better, no ladder is required to place or retrieve MagnaHangs from high ceilings. This optional extension pole is in the development stages and is anticipated to be released soon.  MagnaHang is an elegant tool designed to hang ornaments, ornamental advertising, product promotions, warning signs, directional aid signs, decorations, picture frames, cards, balloons, garland, lights, fabrics, paper advertisements, electrical cords, posters, wreathes and so much more.

The MagnaHang name and invention has been filed for patent and trademark protection. The inventor of the MagnaHang, John Glover, cultivated the idea with the desire to create and develop a better, more attractive way to hang ornaments on the Christmas tree. In doing so, he found a method for hanging ornaments, as well as other items, that provided additional applications such as on walls, in doorways, and other places where a magnetic connection can be utilized. The primary product application is for hanging holiday decorative ornaments, especially for Christmas and other holiday decorations.

Each MagnaHang is made using a beaded brass rod that is attached to a barrel that contains an embedded magnet. At the opposite end, the wire hooks into the ornament or other objects to be displayed. In between are decorative beads and collars to beautify the device.  In the first application, the object to be displayed will most likely be a Christmas ball or similar ornament. The MagnaHang is also provided with an additional “Backer Magnet" to increase the weight capacity, or to establish a magnetic connection as with hanging on fabric, glass windows, synthetic plants or “real” and artificial Christmas trees.

Each MagnaHang is approximately 3 ½ inches long, and the " Shortys" are approximately two (2.0) inches long.  The bendable brass shaft is beaded with typically 3-8 beads of varying styles and colors, depending upon the ball, globe or ornament color being attached to it, or the season for which the MagnaHang is intended (i.e. reds and pinks for Valentine’s Day, red’s and greens for Christmas, etc.)

FUNDING

When the funding goal is met, MagnaHang will enabled to commit material suppliers and the dedicated fulfillment service,  sufficient to fulfill "Perks" for Indiegogo campaign supporters, as well as a residual inventory to initiate a conservative, well-managed marketing effort using social media and direct marketing professionals.  With successful funding of our campaign we can aggressively employ these such experts to help MagnaHang proliferate to both domestic and global customers.

We anticipate that our company will achieve maximum efficiency with the achievement of successful funding, wherein we can employ hundreds and highly anticipated potentially thousands of workers at multiple fulfillment centers within the US.

MANUFACTURING

MagnaHang’s precision machined barrel is machined and laser inscribed in the USA by contracted American vendors. The barrel and other components are pressed and assembled together at a secondary location from where they will also be shipped.

MARKETING

MagnaHang will be introduced initially using social media, to include Pinterest, Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.  However, as indicated under “Funding”, our ability to accelerate needed growth will be greatly enhanced when our funding goal is met. Such enhancements include employing the services of professional social media experts and direct marketing professionals. With the success of reaching our funding goal we can more aggressively employ said social media experts and employ professional services of a direct marketing firm, Harvest Growth of Castle Rock, Colorado. We have developed a close relationship with Harvest Growth throughout the development of this product.  As MagnaHang’s design and functionality becomes more commonplace, and the market requires a lesser degree of education, our marketing emphasis can shift to include marketing through the plethora of mail-order catalog companies and retail department stores. We anticipate continually producing and releasing a string of promotional videos and commercials to keep the product and company fresh and interesting.

ORDER FULFILLMENT

The "order fulfillment" arm of CAROBA Inc., is ready and committed to provide this service in the near and mid-term.  CAROBA's services and capabilites include staff for warehouse space, material management managers, and product assembly and order fulfillment. CAROBA has ample room and capacity for expansion if needed.  These services can be internalized by MagnaHang should it be determined to be most prudent.
 

CUSTOMER SERVICE

Consumer acceptance and brand recognition are key to remaining competitive. MagnaHang will stand behind its brand and the quality of its product. Customer Service will be handled by MagnaHang employees. Thus far, the company has been able to rely on the help of friends and family to bring MagnaHang to fruition. These wonderful people are committed to the product, its management, and the virtually unlimited possibilities it holds. MagnaHang’s ownership team is committed to making this product a success while making the world a better place, and is prepared to do whatever is legal and moral to see this simple yet amazing product fulfill its potential and destiny.

OUR MISSION

MagnaHang truly embodies a dream of an inventor, John Glover, and a group of faithful  small investors who believe in the appeal this new product will have by much of the world. Not only will MagnaHang bring joy to its users and beauty to nearly every environment, it will be priced affordable for most everyone. Altruistically, the MagnaHang partnership is COMMITTED to creating jobs in the USA.   As such, we have aligned ourselves with vendors throughout the United Sates to provide the materials and services needed for manufacture and distribution.

From materials to fabrication, assembly and fulfillment, MagnaHangs WILL be a QUALITY American product that brings jobs and revenue home to America through both domestic and global sales. Part of our vision is that we want to be the “Zippo Lighter” of the decorating industry; well made, passed down from generation to generation and guaranteed for life. And like Jelly Belly candies, Hershey chocolates and Zippo, we’ll take pleasure in offering public tours of our Manufacturing facility.  Finally, as fiscal strength grows sufficient, MagnaHang will become a largely sincephilanthropic company that seeks opportunities to contribute to helping the helpless and bringing solutions to the hopeless. Opportunities to do so are endless, and we yearn for the time when we can do so. Indiegogo enables value driven entrepreneurs, like us, to build and grow a product our way, which we believe to be the right way.

Perks

It's our pleasure to express our gratitude for pledges made on a variety of levels.  The following is an overview of how we anticipate expressing our appreciation; 

  • $3 Contribution

Thank you for your contribution, we appreciate your support! Your donations will contribute to the launch of a revolutionary new product that will undoubtedly be a blessing to nearly every home and business in America and beyond. Equally important will be the number of USA jobs that will be created and maintained at our manufacturing sites, first in Denver Colorado, and later in strategic locations in the United States. A “thank you” e-mail message sent personally from the MagnaHang inventor, John Glover. When they are available, we hope you’ll order or pick up a pack! Your name will be included on our website as one of our charter contributors. Again, thank you so much.
